Hamas leader Abdel Aziz Rantisi has been killed today in Gaza City. I'm sure this is just another attack that will further the cycle of violence. Since the killing of the former Hamas leader Sheik Yassin, many Palestinian women and children have been killed or injured. The unilateral decision for Israel to oppress and punish it's neighbor continues on. Curfews, restrictions of water, the building of the wall, people beaten and shot at peaceful rallies, demolition of homes, jailing of children, I could go on forever. One leader was killed today, but Palestinians die all the time. Contrary to what Sharon says, the Palestinian people do not have a partner in peace, Israeli's have only shown means of oppression and terror. It is a shame that through media related propaganda, the victims, the Palestinians have had little to no coverage. I understand that the Israeli's suffer from the fear and the horror of suicide bombings. However the Palestinians go through anguish and collective punishment on a daily basis, they have witnessed the destruction of their economy by the Israeli government, they have seen there towns and facilities taken away from them before their eyes. They have seen their children, wives, husbands and relatives die. They live under an oppressive force that has no compassion or remorse. This latest killing is just another attempt to unilaterally destroy the hopes of a two state solutions, the hopes of preserving order, and the hopes of viable peace.
